definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Following his defeat in 1815, the French monarchy was re-established.
sentences.chinese: 1815年，隨着他的勝利，法國君主政體再次建立。

sentences.english: Medieval Christianity would itself,therefore, imitate the structures of monarchy and empire.
sentences.chinese: 因此中世紀基督教自己，模仿君主政體和帝國的結構。

sentences.english: The triumph of monarchy in modern Britain dates from that morning.
sentences.chinese: 當代英國君主政體的勝利追溯到那天上午。

sentences.english: The Declaration represented a repudiation of the pre-Revolutionary monarchical regime.
sentences.chinese: 這一宣言代表了對大革命前的君主政體的批判。

sentences.english: The monarchy is seen by some as an anachronism in present-day society.
sentences.chinese: 君主政體在當今社會中被一些人視爲是過時的制度。

sentences.english: The central institution of Saudi Arabian Government is the Saudi monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 沙特阿拉伯政府的中央機構是沙特君主政體。

sentences.english: For all that time France had been an absolute monarchy .
sentences.chinese: 因爲那時法國是個專制的君主政體。
現代的君主政體是不合時宜的事物。
